isis.stitle: HOOD, GRILLE, FENDERS AND BUMPER - 7000 - front end options - fENDERETTES

svcprocinfo.para: Fenderettes are mounted at the outer edge of the front wheel openings on the fender valance section and on the rear fender extension. The fenderettes provide increased splash protection for the cab structure and steps. Fenderettes are furnished to fit both the set forward axle application wheel well opening, and the standard axle location opening on the 7300 through the 7500 model series.

svcsubproc.title: Fenderette Removal
svcsubproc.para: Fenderettes are a two piece molded assembly, each section mounts to different areas. The forward section attaches to the valance assembly and hood. The aft section attaches to the fender extension and fender assembly.

step1.para: Tilt hood and locate fenderette mounting nuts and bolts.
Loosen and remove mounting nuts and bolts.

svcsubproc.title: Fenderette Install
svcsubproc.para: When mounting fenderette sections locate the forward or aft fenderette ( Figure 66, Item 3) section. The fenderette fits both standard and set forward axle application.

step1.para: Locate and align mounting holes of fenderette and fender section, valance section or fender extension.
Insert mounting bolts through fenderette mounting holes into valance section, fender section or fender extension.
Insert mounting nuts on mounting bolts, hand tighten.
Make sure overlap fenderette is aligned properly.
Tighten nuts to required torque value.
